title: Personal Portfolio Website

requirements.text: Create a single-page portfolio website with the following sections: Hero (name, tagline, call-to-action), About Me, Skills, Projects, and Contact. Each section should be navigable via a sticky top navigation bar.

quotes: i want to create a portfolio website for my profile

acceptanceCriteria: Sticky navigation bar links scroll smoothly to each section
Hero section displays a name placeholder, short tagline, and a CTA button
About Me section contains a bio text block and a profile avatar placeholder
Skills section lists skill categories with visual indicators (e.g., badges or progress bars)
Projects section shows a grid of project cards with title, description, and link placeholders
Contact section includes name, email, and message fields with a submit button

requirements.text: Store portfolio data (bio, skills, projects) in the backend so that the content is persisted and can be read by the frontend.

quotes: i want to create a portfolio website for my profile

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query functions to retrieve bio text, skills list, and projects list
Data is stored in stable variables so it survives canister upgrades
Backend exposes update functions to modify bio, skills, and projects

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, modern dark-mode visual theme with a monochrome-and-amber accent palette, clean sans-serif typography, subtle gradient backgrounds, and smooth section transitions. The design should feel professional and creative, suitable for a developer or designer portfolio.
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent color scheme (dark background, amber/gold accents) applied across all sections
Typography uses a clean, professional sans-serif font with clear heading hierarchy
Hover and scroll animations feel smooth and polished
Layout is fully responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports

requirements.text: Generate and display a stylized abstract hero background image and a professional avatar placeholder image, served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section uses the generated abstract background as a full-width background image
About Me section displays the generated avatar placeholder image

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
Generated images must be served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated, not through the backend
nonGoals: CMS or third-party content management integrations
